page.title: 16MUNDON SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The sewage comes from the houses in {Mundon, Purleigh,Latchingdon and {Fambridge,}and some light industries and factories. First the sewage arrives at the pumping house. It is then pumped up to the settling tanks, where the solids are removed. Then it is pumped into another settling tank, then the force of the water going down hill, drives the sprinkler poles round and sprinkles the water onto the clinker beds. The bacteria in the clinker kills off most of the germs, then the water goes into the lagoons and river. When the settling beds get full of solids it is dredged out and taken away and spread on farm land as manure.
